post_text: On Saturday, July 11, 2020, school administration was made aware that a group of students were exposed to an individual outside the school district who later tested positive for COVID-19. Those potentially exposed students then attended summer conditioning on Thursday and Friday. Out of an abundance of caution, all summer conditioning/workouts have been postponed until Thursday, July 16, 2020. By that time, county health departments will have had the opportunity to perform contact tracing, fully inform the individuals involved and more conclusive information will be available to make potential further decisions. We appreciate your understanding and will continue to keep you updated as much as possible.

post_text:
As we begin moving forward, it is worth noting that our staff really misses our students, parents, and community!

Tears were shed by teachers during meetings today as it became reality that students would not be back in the building.

Brainstorming was done by administrators to simply provide some sort of normalcy for our families during this time.

Classified staff have shown great dedication the past week but it just isn’t the same without our families.

Said by one of our bus drivers today, “Looking back at these empty seats is horrible! I put off taking the bus to the bus barn as long as I could. While driving along I thought of all the faces I miss in the mirror and miss each one of them. Hope this world gets normal again very soon. I truly love being a bus driver!”

As we roll out our new plans for the remainder of the year, we just wanted to say we miss all you guys! We truly love doing what we do and will remain committed to serving you!

post_text: It is that time of year! Important information about which kind of flu you may have and what the flu shot covers.
shared_text:
Osage County Health Department
January 6 at 2:40 PM ·

Illnesses commonly spike during and after the holidays due to people congregating together. Our communities are seeing an increase in BOTH influenza and the "stomach flu." These are very different illnesses, and the "flu shot" protects against influenza (the respiratory illness) NOT the "stomach flu." If you have not gotten your flu shot, there's still time and we have it in stock at the Health Department. To help avoid illnesses including the "stomach flu," be sure to wash your hands frequently, avoid sharing drinks or food with anyone, and avoid those who are sick if possible. The graphic below helps show the difference between INFLUENZA and the "stomach flu."

post_text: For well over a year, the USD 456 Board of Education has worked diligently in developing a cohesive plan to address varying facility needs within the district that can be addressed through our capital outlay fund. That work has developed into a tentative five-year plan. The attached flyer details the proposed plan for this year and the potential projects on the horizon. We are excited to see the progress proposed for this year and looking forward to establishing a cycle of improvements that will allow our district to thrive for generations to come!

1A Regional Volleyball brackets have been released!

MDCV has been assigned to the regional tournament at Centre High School, with MDCV receiving the #5 seed for the tournament. MDCV will match up against #4 seed Wakefield at 3:00pm in the Centre High School gym on October 22nd, 2019.

Each match will begin approximately 20 minutes after the conclusion of the previous match.

Please be aware that league passes are not accepted for regional, substate or state volleyball. Ticket prices will be $5.00 for a K-12th grade student and $6.00 for an adult.

Good luck to our Trojan Volleyball team!
